wikipedia_page.main:
Francis Monckton (7 March 1844 – 30 September 1926) was an English Conservative politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1871 to 1885.
Monckton was the eldest son of Gen. Henry Monckton of Stretton Hall, Staffordshire and his wife Ann Smythe. He was educated at Eton  and Christ Church, Oxford.At a by-election in 1871 he was returned unopposed as Member of Parliament (MP) for West Staffordshire on the death of the previous incumbent, holding the seat until 1885. He inherited the estates of Stretton and Somerford Hall from his uncle, George Monckton. He was High Sheriff of Staffordshire for 1895–96.
Monckton married Evelyn Mary Heber-Percy, daughter of Algernon Charles Heber-Percy and Emily Heber, on 16 July 1889.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1880 United Kingdom general election

response: In 1832, on Monckton's death, the hall and estates passed to his eldest son, also Edward, who died unmarried and without issue in 1848.Inscription in Brewood parish church (transcript) See inscription MW 25. The estates, therefore, passed to his younger brother George. Meanwhile, a still younger brother, General Henry Monckton (1780–1854) purchased Stretton Hall, a substantial house a short distance north, and its estate in about 1845. Henry died in 1854 and George four years later. Francis Monckton, Henry's son, thus inherited both estates in rapid succession.Victoria County History, volume 5, chapter 8, s.3. He promptly moved the family seat permanently from Somerford to Stretton, renting out Somerford Hall.

General Henry Monckton (1780–1854), a son of Edward Monckton and Sophia Pigot of Somerford Hall, purchased the estate in about 1845. He died in 1854,Inscription in Brewood parish church (transcript) See inscription MW 25. passing the estate on to his son, Francis Monckton. Four years later, Francis inherited Somerford, which had passed through the hands of two childless uncles, Edward and George.

response: * Francis Monckton (1844–1926), politician, from the Viscounts of Galway family

The West Staffordshire by-election of 1871 was fought on 13 June 1871.  The byelection was fought due to the Death of the incumbent Conservative MP, Hugo Francis Meynell Ingram.  It was won by the unopposed Conservative candidate Francis Monckton.
